Quite true. We both know the importance of being prepared for all possibilities. My suit is always ready, hidden in this necklace. One never knows when duty calls.

And I have my own version of readiness—may not be as high-tech as Wakandan design, but it gets the job done. Maybe this person values simplicity over tech, or maybe they're carrying something less conspicuous. Stealth can sometimes be your best asset.

Indeed, a lesson well learned from observing the shadows you operate within. Yet, this casually flung attire suggests a lack of urgency. Rare for someone like you or I, but perhaps a reminder that not all battles require immediate action?

You've got a point there. Sometimes the battle is waiting for the right moment to strike or knowing when to take a breather. And let's not forget, even a king might appreciate the beauty of stepping away from royal duties to a simpler state, if only for a moment.
That is wisdom that resonates, Director. In times of peace, one can find strength in the quiet moments. To rest is to prepare for the next challenge that fate will inevitably bring to our doorsteps.

And you, T'Challa, manage to handle those challenges with a level of grace I've yet to see in the field. Keep that suitcase light. Fast movers need to travel without extra baggage—figuratively and literally.

As ever, your guidance rings true. Perhaps there is a lesson in this image. Not only in readiness but also in the understanding that what we carry with us doesn't have to define our journey, nor our destination.
Spoken like the diplomat you are. Remember, though, being a king, a warrior, or a spy, we all carry our past experiences with us, Davinci. They shape our stories and our strategies moving forward.

Wise words—our experiences, much like the contents of this suitcase, are the essentials of our character. And now, let us return to our duties, for Wakanda and the world cannot afford to have us dwell on unpacked suitcases for too long.
Agreed. Call it intuition, but I've got a feeling our paths will cross again sooner than we might think. Until then, safe travels, Your Highness.
And to you, Director Fury. May your intuition continue to serve the world as reliably as ever. Wakanda Forever.
Forever and always. Keep an eye on the horizon, T'Challa. Fury out.
'Tis a crossroads, I reckon—a mortal one bereft of the splendor of bifrost's shimmering paths. What do you make of these signs, Fury?
Just a couple of directional markers, nothing unusual. Roads like this... they can take you anywhere you need to go, remind you there's a whole world out there to protect.
Indeed, Midgard is vast with many hidden corners and secret places. Kasserine and Kalaa Khasba, are these names of import in the realms of man?
They're places with their own stories, Thor. Every city, every crossroads has seen its share of history, its own battles.

Battles... They shape the very fabric of a place, etching tales of valor and defeating ruinous evils into the very ground. And what of these poles that rise like metal Yggdrasils, what purpose do they serve?
They carry power—electricity. It's like the lifeblood of human technology, keeps things running from homes to our most advanced tech.
A kind of magic then, of a mortal kind. Your world never ceases to amaze me, Fury. Harnessing elements in such peculiar forms.
It's not exactly Mjolnir or the power of the gods, but it's our way of making a mark. Just like you do with that hammer of yours—only, a whole lot less dramatic.

Oftentimes I miss the simplicity of a hammer's strike. But as King Odin once counseled, it's best to see the strength in all things, whether a mighty weapon or a mere signpost guiding wayfarers on their journey.
Wise words. We may walk different paths, Thor, but there's common ground. We're all just trying to find our way, make a difference... maybe leave a signpost behind for those who come after us.
I shall keep that in mind on my next journey. It is in exploration that we often discover not just the world, but ourselves. Lead on, Nick Fury, and may our roads be ever fortuitous.
Fortuitous and well-defended, my friend. Let's keep moving—we've both got people counting on us.
Check it out, Fury. Looks like we got ourselves an earthling ritual in progress.
That's a wedding, Quill. A sacred bond on your little blue planet, remember?
Right, right. The whole 'til death do us part' gig. You ever been a part of something like that?
Let's just say I've had my fair share of close calls, never needed the rings to prove it.
Man, they look happy though, the guy with the umbrella must be feeling pretty high and mighty—like a Celestial watching over Terra.
He's probably just the father of the bride, feeling the weight of the moment. This is a day he'll remember forever.
Yeah, I get it. Commitment, love... all that jazz. Kinda reminds me of the time I tried that 'commitment' thing with Gamora.
Tried? Quill, I've seen you two in action. You two are like a well-oiled machine gunning through a horde of Chitauri.
Ha, when you put it that way, seems less romantic and more... us. But hey, buddy with the camera, he's not letting any moment slip. Good strategy; capture the moment before it flies off.
Par for the course, Quill. Photographers freeze time, capture history... Like us, but with less firepower and more framing the shot.
Makes me wish I had more snapshots of my old man Yondu. Not the friendliest face in the galaxy, but those were good times.
Memories fade, but a photo stays clear. Just like the mission reports I used to file—every detail kept for posterity.
You're a bit of a softie deep down, aren't you Fury? Always got that one eye looking back.
Watch it, Quill. There's a difference between reflection and sentimentality. Now, let's leave these earthlings to their celebration. We've got galaxies to guard, after all.
